title: 108_hr3514
content: The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 is the short title of this Act. The table of contents for this Act is provided. The Act includes provisions for the disposal of administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania, as well as the conveyance of various ranger district headquarters and residences in different counties. It also addresses the disposition of funds and the administration of land acquired by the United States. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including US Tract 121 and US Tract 896. US Tract 1047 (formerly Tracts 551, 551a,b,c) is the original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters on 4.90 acres. US Tract 844 is the Marienville ranger residence, with a portion subject to conveyance. The property descriptions are detailed in maps referenced in the subsection. The maps referenced in subsection (a) are the primary descriptions of the lands. In case of a conflict with metes and bounds descriptions, the map prevails unless it cannot be found. The maps are available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Consideration for land conveyance includes authorized compensation. The recipient of land under subsection (a) can convey other land or improvements with Secretary's consent. The Secretary can accept cash payments exceeding 25% of land value in exchange. Conveyance of land is subject to applicable laws and regulations. The Secretary may give preference to public entities for land conveyance if used for public purposes. Offers for land conveyance can be solicited with specified terms and conditions. The Secretary has the authority to reject offers if deemed necessary. The Secretary may reject offers for land conveyance if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. Upon land conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. Additional terms and conditions may be required by the Secretary to protect US interests. SEC. 3. Conveyance of Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" is the definitive description of the lands being conveyed by the Secretary of Agriculture. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked upon conveyance. The map will be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. The Secretary of Agriculture is conveying the Ridgeway Ranger District headquarters in Elk County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture is authorizing the conveyance of US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania. Ridgeway Township must pay the fair market value for the lands as determined by an acceptable appraisal. The Secretary authorizes the conveyance of US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, at fair market value determined by an acceptable appraisal. Property descriptions in maps are definitive unless maps are unavailable. Maps are available for public inspection until lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 5. CONVEYANCE OF MARIENVILLE RANGER RESIDENCE, FOREST COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence, identified as Lot 2 on a Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller in 1999. The map is the primary description of the lands. In case of a conflict between map and metes/bounds descriptions, the map is the definitive description unless it cannot be located. The map must be on file for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon land conveyance by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales and exchanges under section 2, as well as consideration from sections 3(b) and 4(b), into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds can be used for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and sites for the Allegheny National Forest, or for acquiring land and interests in land. The Secretary of Agriculture deposits proceeds from sales and exchanges into the Sisk Act Fund for acquiring land and interests in the Allegheny National Forest. Land acquisition is subject to a condition where the market value of acquired lands cannot exceed 125% of the market value of lands disposed of under this Act. The Secretary of Agriculture manages lands acquired under the Act of March 1, 1911 and other relevant laws. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest are adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition under this Act. SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. This Act does not affect the Secretary of Agriculture's other land sale, exchange, or acquisition authorities. Lands approved for disposal under this Act are not subject to certain sections of title 40, United States Code.
